alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:27AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Weld County through 600 AM MDT... At 526 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Carpenter to 5 miles southwest of Carr, or along a line extending from 16 miles southeast of Cheyenne to 21 miles north of Fort Collins. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carr and Rockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
